before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"5diqe","text":"Do aliquots of 1 mL of sterile milliQ water.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dg6sg","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d9td","text":"Before starting, place all the supplies and sterile milliQ Water needed for the PCR under the PCR hood and switch on the UV light for at least 20 min.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"acek4","text":"Nowadays metabarcoding approaches allow to explore the diversity of different communities using next-generation sequencing (NGS).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ikjt","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bho1f","text":"Here we describe the 16S-V4V5 DNA amplification method applied for both prokaryote and eukaryotes metabarcoding analyses using Illumina Miseq technology. This protocol has been used in many projects studying prokaryotic and eukaryotic diversity (TARA-OCEANS 2009-2013, TARA-PACIFIC 2016-2018), and prokaryote monitoring projects (ROSCOFF ASTAN 2009-ongoing).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87d4","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adc15","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jb4l","text":"We developed the flowchart for 2 different sequencing platforms : Fasteris-Gene Support SA (Plan-Les-Ouates, Swiss) and GeT-PlaGE (Toulouse, France).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.description: {"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":144,"length":19,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8v0jo","text":"Amplicons from each DNA sample are all pooled in a single microtube. Each pool of amplicons will be considered as a \"library sample \" or called \"Pooled Amplicons\" and loaded on a Miseq 2x250 run.","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3nb9p","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7u8v9","text":"To allow the latter separation of each sample in the Pooled Amplicon sample, each DNA is amplified using forward tagged primer built with a structure 5'-NNNN-MID-forwardprimer'. The reverse primer is not modified.","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5kqpb","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8hkmu","text":"The tag, or Multiplex IDentifier (MID) is a unique short sequence of 7 or 8 bases compatible with the forward primer V4f and generated using the matrix oligoTag program (Coissac et al. 2012). We also added 4 N at the 5' extremity of the forward primer to help MID sequence conservation during the cluster synthesis step on the steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"60ef5","text":"Lyophilized Tagged-primers are obtained at Eurogentec, using the RP-Cartridge Gold purification.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d83c4","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akfs8","text":"Work always under the PCR hood.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hq07","text":"PCR reactions are performed using the Taq polymerase Phusion High-Fidelity Master Mix with GC buffer (Thermofisher, Cat No F-532 L).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":53,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rdal","text":"This Taq  has a good proof-reading and its buffer allows amplification of high GC templates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amuj1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f901c","text":"Keep the same annealing temperature as the one is used with the usual 16S-V4V5 primer set.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vit7","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3lib","text":"First test each of your taggeg-primer sets on a positive and a negative control following steps 5, 6, 7 and 8.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q2c5","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e93pq","text":"Then you can perform DNA sample amplification following next steps.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bc9q","text":"PCR Mix preparation :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fslfe","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8gjpc","text":"PCR Programm :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5scjb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ipp2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3043","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5ovus","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g2cv","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a94u2","text":"In order to reduce the artificial building of chimeras during the PCR process, the # of cycles must be reduced to a minimum : 25, max 30 (chimeras formation mainly during the plateau-phase of the PCR reaction).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tn1p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"193F7B89772911EFAE630A58A9FEAC02","height":169,"id":500546,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Progaremme PCR Phusion.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ri349ufn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ri4c9ufn.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ri4b9ufn.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a82je","text":"PCR products are purified using the purification kit: NucleoSpin® PCR Clean-Up (Macherey-Nagel, cat. nb 740609.50 or 740609.250 ).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":75}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cme3","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2brft","text":"Store the kit at room temperature.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6imqo","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3h0a","text":"  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"309F7073344F11EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Instruction-NucleoSpin-Gel-and-PCR-Clean-up.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/fwan9ufn.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c913","text":"Prepare Purification Run Table and pool the triplicate PCR into a single microtube with appropriate labelling (sample, target and tag-MID nb, PCR date).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9evue","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lfkas","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d7s0q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"30A0DF3C344F11EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":120,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"PCR purification 16S.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gmz39ufn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gmzz9ufn.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmz29ufn.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gmzy9ufn.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bocq","text":"Mix 1 vol of sample with 2 volumes of buffer NT.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1oiic","text":"Follow the instructions of manufacturer (mentioned in the Step 9), except for the elution step.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdijc","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cl6e","text":"Elution Step : ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3djs4","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ggia","text":"- Place the NucleoSpin PCR Clean-Up Column into a clean 1.5mL microtube correctly labeled (sample, target tagged-MID, date).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l86f","text":"- Add 22 µL buffer NE preheated at 65°C directly onto the column and incubate 5 min @ 65°C.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"256ck","text":"- Centrifuge 1 min @ 11 000 g.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fp3e","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5udk0","text":"Store the purified PCR products at -20°C or directly do the quantification.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f67h8","text":"PCR products are quantified using the quantification kit: Quant-iT™ PicoGreen® dsDNA reagent *2000 assays* (Invitrogen, cat nb P7581) and a Fluorometer Plate readerFluorometer Plate reader, following the manufacturer's protocol.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ec6k","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt8i3","text":"  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7u8dg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"30A55D36344F11EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Quant-it Picogreen dsDNA kit.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/fway9ufn.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3hfcj","text":"After quantification of the PCR products, amplicons will be pooled before shipment to  the NGS Fasteris sequencing platform.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79fve","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9de5h","text":"One final tube (called \"Pooled Amplicons\") will contain all pooled amplicons at equimolar concentration, ready for the library preparation. The amounts and volume required by Fasteris are : 1μg of equimolar amplicon pool in 30 μl (so Pool Amplicons concentration should be \u003e35 ng/µL) .","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":190,"length":95}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a346n","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26mfa","text":"The volume of each amplicon that will added in the tube \"Pooled Amplicons\" is calculated based on their average concentration as follows :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ford8","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dala","text":"Calculation table for Pooled Amplicons preparation :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"887q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7xpf9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bx5uw","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"entityRanges":null,"data":{}},{"key":"2obok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5plj5","text":"If the final volume of Pooled Amplicons is higher than 30 µL, (so concentration inferior to 35ng/µL), an additionnal concentration step will be necessary. For this we used the purification kit: NucleoSpin® PCR Clean-Up (Macherey-Nagel, cat. nb 740609.50 or 740609.250 ).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":194,"length":75}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"30A80EAB344F11EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":270,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Pool amplicons_annotated_16S.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gmz79ufn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gmz59ufn.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gmz69ufn.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gmz49ufn.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2hgk5","text":"PCR reactions are performed using the Taq polymerase Phusion High-Fidelity Master Mix with GC buffer (Thermofisher, Cat No F-532 L).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":53,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2bn0b","text":"This Taq  has a good proof-reading and its buffer allows amplification of high GC templates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"389l2","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hffn","text":"Keep the same annealing temperature as the one is used with the usual 16S-V4V5 primer set.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej1vv","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbusp","text":"First test each of your taggeg-primer sets on a positive and a negative control following steps 5, 6, 7 and 8.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7odnq","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sojk","text":"Then you can perform DNA sample amplification following next steps.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ac0t7","text":"Prepare PCR1 Table and pool the triplicate reactions into a single well in a new semi-skirted PCR plate with appropriate labelling (Run ID, date).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"buune","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jwn7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5dm97","text":"Seal the Plate containing the amplicons pools to avoid evaporation risk and store it at -20°C until shipment.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u1ao","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"30E6259E344F11EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":264,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Pool amplicon -GeT_16S_final.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gm2d9ufn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gm2b9ufn.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gm2c9ufn.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gm2a9ufn.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6eg5","text":"Plate containing the pooled amplicons must to be shipped via Dry Ice to the following address :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46ruo","text":"Plateforme GeT-Biopuces","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erchp","text":"INSA/TBI","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"biv83","text":"Bât 39 - Bio5","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abnpv","text":"135 Avenue de Rangueil","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hvba","text":"31077 Toulouse Cedex 04","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8f8ji","text":"FRANCE","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"de8vh","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75k9q","text":"Additonnal documents to include in the package (that must also be sent by e-mail) :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffbue","text":"- sample file PCR1 (= plate's plan, and amplicon's size);","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eicto","text":"- Miseq prestation file completed and signed","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h95r","text":"NB : These files are given by the platform.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"diuf1","text":"Elute dried primers at 100 µM with TE 1X sterile buffer under a PCR hood.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83hbb","text":"Primer dissolution is done for 15 min at room temperature under the hood.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b38ae","text":"Short vortex and spin.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"h34u","text":"Primer working solutions are then prepared at 10 µM with sterile milliQ water molecular grade.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f99jl","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1i7vi","text":"For each MID-primer, add 10 µL of 100 µM of Stock primer to 90 µL in a 1.5mL sterile microtube correctly labeled (MID###, concentration, date, operator).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4l9t6","text":"Stock primers and primer working solutions are stored at -20°C.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avv5t","text":"PCR plate's plan :","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6u15v","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3n6p1","text":"Each DNA sample (DNA1, DNA2, DNA3...) will be amplified with its own tagged-MID-primer (515fY-M8R001, 515fY-M8R004, 515fY-M8R005...). So there will be as many PCR mix preparations as there are DNA samples to amplify.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":134,"length":82}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qdot","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5cj5","text":"In order to get enough material (50 ng), triplicate the PCR reactions on each DNA sample (you will pool them after).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ojct","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hbve","text":"One positive control and one negative control will be added for each PCR mix preparation.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99hvr","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbbcq","text":"PCR reactions are prepared on a semi-skirted 96-wells PCR plate (like AB-0900 PCR plate).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"468da","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"em7uc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qrmgh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"55BD27D2344F11EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":173,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"PCR plate.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/fzzp9ufn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gm2v9ufn.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gm2u9ufn.webp","width":550}}}}
